greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of the constant x that satisfies x = exp(1/sqrt(x)).
comment: This constant arises from the series: S(n) = Sum_{k=0..2n} (n-[k/2])^k/k!. The asymptotic behavior of this series is given by: S(n) ~ c*x^n where c = (x+sqrt(x))/(1+2*sqrt(x)) = 0.8957126... and x = 2.0207473586... satisfies x = exp(1/sqrt(x)).
example: To demonstrate how this constant describes the asymptotics of the sum:
and evaluate the sum at n=6:
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Oct 22 2004
